content: "The contributions of Nikola Tesla to modern electrical engineering": Compose a short biography of Nikola Tesla, emphasizing his major contributions to modern electrical engineering.

Nikola Tesla was a Serbian-American inventor, electrical engineer, mechanical engineer, and physicist best known for his contributions to the design of the modern alternating current (AC) electricity supply system. Born in 1856 in what is now Croatia, Tesla emigrated to the United States in 1884 and began working with Thomas Edison. However, their professional relationship was short-lived due to differing opinions on electrical systems.

Tesla's major contributions to modern electrical engineering include the development of the AC induction motor, the AC power transmission system, and the Tesla coil. His work on AC systems was revolutionary because it allowed for the efficient transmission of electricity over long distances, which was not possible with direct current (DC) systems. This made it possible to distribute electricity to homes and businesses across entire cities and regions.

Tesla also made significant contributions to the fields of radio and wireless communication. He experimented with radio waves before Guglielmo Marconi and even demonstrated wireless transmission of electrical energy. However, his work in this area was largely overshadowed by Marconi's achievements, and it wasn't until years later that Tesla's pioneering work was recognized.

In addition to his technical contributions, Tesla was also known for his showmanship and ability to capture the public's imagination with his demonstrations of wireless energy transfer and other futuristic concepts. He held over 300 patents worldwide for his inventions and is considered one of the most important figures in the history of electrical engineering.

Tesla's legacy continues to influence modern technology, and his ideas have inspired countless inventors and engineers. His story is a testament to the power of innovation and the impact that one person can have on the world through their ideas and inventions.
